definition: to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: Because of the great gloom that is in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 因为我心中藏着巨大的忧闷。

sentences.english: And Demetrius heard these words, and was exceeding sorry, and said.
sentences.chinese: 德默特琉一听说了这事，便忧闷地说。

sentences.english: I hear some rustle of things behind my sadness of heart.
sentences.chinese: 我听见有些东西在我心的忧闷后面萧萧作响。

sentences.english: She was still bitter about her failure.
sentences.chinese: 她对于自己的失败，依然忧闷在心。

sentences.english: It makes the desponding hopeful, the gloomy joyous.
sentences.chinese: 它使灰心的有指望，忧闷的快乐。

sentences.english: In those days I Daniel mourned the days of three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 在这些日子里，我达尼尔忧闷了三个星期。

sentences.english: Desolate as she was, Tamar stayed in her brother Absalom's house.
sentences.chinese: 塔玛尔从此就忧闷不乐，住在她哥哥阿贝沙隆家里。

sentences.english: Why are you in despair, O my soul?
Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why so disturbed within me?
sentences.chinese: 我的心哪，你为何忧闷，为何在我里面烦躁。

sentences.english: People began to be concerned about the air pollution here.
sentences.chinese: 人们起头对这里的大气污染暗示忧闷。

sentences.english: 6 (His father had never interfered with him by asking, 'Why do you behave as you do?'
sentences.chinese: 他父亲素来没有使他忧闷，说，你是作什么呢？

definition: to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
